column2: my third one from this series and&nbsp

column1: Comes in a polybag and has the small instructions you get with them. Instructions are clear and easy to follow.
There are some unique parts in this. You get the silver pistol which isn'
column2: t a common shade for them to come in. You also get the CMS minifigure stand, and then the back of the stand is also a really nice piece as well.&nbsp
Mine Worker. It is a really cool and unique figure to get. This is the&nbsp
column3: figures first appearance in Lego. He is armed with a silver pistol. The head is really well done. The detail is really nice on the mask. The red over the eyes is&nbsp
column4: a nice touch. There is printing on the back of the head as well. The body has printing on both sides as well. You have a belt that is half on the body and half on the legs. On the body&nbsp
column6: markings that seem to indicate some sort of rank among the mine workers. Then there are some stains of somesort on both the body and all over the legs. Overall this is a great figure to get.&nbsp

column1: Really easy to build. Took me a couple minutes to build. There is 1 sticker.

After finishing it is really good for display. The stand is exactly the same as the others. The back is different. The image on it looks to be a control room were the mine workers, work at. You are able to connect them to each other for display.

Overall this is a another great figure in this series. The detail of the printing is great. They did a really good job on it. This is my favorite of the three I own so far (I also own DJ and the R3-M2). Overall I'
column2: m giving it a 5 star rating.&nbsp

This set is for collectors, the exclusive print is cool, and the minifigure is pretty good for making customs, but I wouldn'
column2: t reccomend it for the average Lego fan.
